adv: The speed of generation invariably creates efficiency in visulaisation.
disadv: The outputs are often cluttered and difficult to understand. The process of 'stripping back' to reveal an underlying pattern or trend isn't employed, which makes many of the charts feel very cluttered and difficult to interpret.
comment:
So try to have the graphics focus more on the gestalt principals. Have them prefer viz' with a lower visual load. Employ more bar charts as these tended to be the best/simplest to interpret quickly compared to many of the dot plots which felt overwhelming. 

If there is a high density of data points clustered around the mean, perhaps have the charts employ an alpha setting for over plotting. This alpha could be a function of the sigma of the relevant data set.
